intro: Lysimachia jingdongensis, commonly known as the Jingdong bugleweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
